title: OpenAI plans giant 1 GW AI data centre in India, Sam Altman may reveal details soon
description: OpenAI, the creator of ChatGPT, is preparing for a big move in India with plans to build one of the country’s largest artificial intelligence data centres. The facility is expected to have at least 1 gigawatt of capacity, making it a project of huge scale.

title: Humans In Demand To Clean Up AI's Mess Amid Job Loss Fears
description: Companies and startups are now turning to human experts to fix the mess created by the use of artificial intelligence.

title: 30-year-old woman dropped out of US university, now has a net worth of around ₹10,800 crore…
description: Lucy Guo, with a net worth of $1.3 billion, co-founded Scale AI, an artificial intelligence data-labelling firm that was acquired by Meta for $25 billion.
content: Lucy Guo, recently named Forbes’ youngest self-made woman billionaire at 30, has opened up about her unconventional path to success. With a net worth of $1.3 billion (around ₹10,800 crore in INR), Guo co-founded Scale AI, an artificial intelligence d... [2980 chars]

title: Healthtech startups bet on AI to build electronic health records but adoption in India remains slow
description: Indian healthtech startups are racing to digitize medical records using artificial intelligence, targeting both urban hospitals and rural clinics.
content: India’s healthtech startups are zeroing in on a critical gap in the healthcare system: the lack of robust, interoperable electronic health records (EHRs). With artificial intelligence as their backbone, companies like Qure.ai, Jivi.ai, Tulu Health, H... [8050 chars]

title: Artificial intelligence offers individualized anticoagulation decisions for atrial fibrillation
description: Mount Sinai researchers developed an AI model to make individualized treatment recommendations for atrial fibrillation (AF) patients-helping clinicians accurately decide whether or not to treat them with anticoagulants (blood thinner medications) to prevent stroke, which is currently the standard treatment course in this patient population.
